alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 1:16PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 116 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Raton Crews Airport, or 10 miles south of Raton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton and Raton Crews Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 436 and 450. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 331 and 344, and between Mile Markers 352 and 359. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
